review: I had a banhmi bowl to-go so my experience is solely based on the quality of the food. I ordered a banh mi bowl with the expectation that it would have the banhmi taste in a bowl - like a salad without the baguette. The food came out okay, not close at all to the banhmi's taste, but it's not bad.  Here's what listed as ingredients: Quinoa, baby kale, fresh cilantro & mint topped with warm grilled chicken, watermelon radish, fresh avocado, cucumber, carrot, bean sprouts, scallions and sesame seeds. Served with housemade chili-lime vinaigrette and serrano peppers.   Generally I'd recommend them to change the name to be less misleading - it's good on its own without having to borrow a name.

Ordered delivery to my hotel through Yelp. Order process was easy and they called to verify the approximate delivery time. Nothing at all was wrong with delivery process.  Wedge salad left a lot to be desired. Lettuce quality could have been much better, especially on a wedge where it's not easily disguised. Asked for no egg on salad and they must have skipped past that comment.  Margherita pizza was average. Not super hot but it wasn't cold either.  Silverware is an extra .29

One of the worst dining experiences I can remember having.  Was with my 5 yr old son enjoying the Gateway mall and Xmas time festivities, and wanted to grab a quick dinner.  The hostess was very nice and got us seated right away on a busy Saturday night.  From there, it was downhill, waited about 15 minutes, no one came by....no water, no acknowledgement, finally flagged a waiter down to place our order.  Then had another 30 minute wait for the food to come out.  Unfortunately, the food I ordered for my son, who was quite hungry and rambunctious, did not come out.  Waited another 5 minutes for his food, by that time just fed up and got out of there.  Food was just ok.  Waitress seemed oblivious.  I've been to many CPKs over the years, and this seems to be the outlier, but man what a buzzkill to an otherwise fun day.

My first thought when I walked into the California Pizza Kitchen to meet my friend for lunch was is this place open? The Gateway feels like a dead zone these days and the new Decor on the outside grounds makes me feel like I'm at some institution rather than a warm friendly communal space. Inside the restaurant we were the only customers at 11:30. We ordered the soup and sandwich combination- a small bowl of soup and a half sandwich that left me still hungry. It should have been priced more like six bucks and then I would understand. But it $9 for a chain launch I could have gotten more food at Cafe Rio. The description on the menu made it sound more filling than it was. The soups themselves were delicious- tortilla and tomato bisque- but the grilled veggie sandwich tasted more like some specialty lettuce and a thin slice of tomato than something brimming with Garden goodness. Even the small shred of mozzarella cheese lacked flavor. Our servers were attentive and friendly.  happy to serve. Though lacking in Ambience, the restaurant itself was clean. I just wish that I didn't feel like I needed to have lunch after my lunch.
After a long drive, walking and visiting temple square this was a great place to eat. The service was great the staff was very friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend this place.

Wow this place is a ghost town, we were one of two tables.  Our server acted like she just survived a busy lunch rush but looking around...I didn't see it. She was efficient tho.  The kids mac and cheese looks and tastes pathetic.  I remember it being one of the best.  The Asian salad lacked half the ingredients it list on the menu.  Mmmmm lettuce.  The chicken club pizza was really tasty.  Place isn't cheap, average $15.  Close to finishing a young couple with a little boy about my sons age started running around the restaurant where i had to get my son under control, as he knows better but I'm shocked the parents didn't say anything as if we were at Mickey D's play land. They had just finished at the fountains it looked like.  Just like the Gateway, this place is dead and has strange patrons.
I love the pizza here! Joey was very attentive and super friendly. Definitely ask if hes working he will certainly take great care of you with 5 star service. Try the steak too it will blow you away!

CPK has some tasty items and is a place I used to eat at quite a bit before discovering more local joints. I especially like the BBQ Chicken salad, which in it's half-size is a decent priced entree and still big enough to fill me up.

I've always had an interesting relationship with CPK, mainly because to me it's just not somewhere that jumps and says "come to me, come to me" when I'm looking for somewhere to eat, but instead somewhere I've generally only gone to because others want to go and I bow to the peer pressure.  And every time I go, it's actually not that bad and I enjoy it...if this is as far as you need to read, my job is done! I think part of it is the name, and the fact that as soon as I see somewhere "specialize" in pizza I assume there's nothing else to offer, and that really isn't the case.  I've debated on prior visits to other locations between 3 or 4 stars because the pizza isn't anything I'd go out of the way for, and while they have many novel flavors, I've never been overly wowed by them, nor would I personally order a whole one for myself.  However, with that, what I can say is there are some good varieties of pizza, and many taste great for a slice or two and then just are lacking after that.  The trick, go with a group and get several varieties and share - it really makes it a much better experience.  My favorites, Original BBQ Chicken, Spicy Chipotle Chicken and Thai Chicken. However, while the pizza may not be quite as extraordinary as the name might be trying to make it out to be, the selection here goes well beyond that with good sandwiches, salads, pastas, soups...I think you get the idea, there is truly something for everyone. On a recent visit to this particular CPK, I got one of their specials which was Roasted Garlic Chicken with Seasonal Vegetables.  This was truly really good, with tender, flavorful chicken along with great tasting caramelized veggies that really hit the spot.  Not much was left and let's just say my plan to have some left overs went straight out the window! Service was good, friendly and our server was totally on top of keeping our waters refilled.  I like the low light ambience of this particular location, it's very warm and inviting and just adds an extra touch that helps it not to seem so chain like. I suspect I may gripe less in the future when a suggestion of CPK comes up!
You really can't go wrong at CPK.  Food is good. The place could use a renovation though.  I've been to much nice ones throughout the country.

So, I am going to a concert tonight, and decided to hit up CPK before I got to the concert. Pizza is delicious so it seemed like an easy call. Note that I'm dining alone. I have currently been sitting at my table for 14 minutes without any service, which is always fun. I've decided to make it a game though. Double fun! Let's see how long it takes for a server to acknowledge me.  *Update* We have surpassed the 20 minute mark! Doors open for the concert in 3 minutes, and while I wasn't planning on being there for the opening band, I at least figured I'd have plenty of time to catch the end of their set. The clock is ticking CPK! The clock is ticking!  *Update 2* There is another solo diner, but in a surprise twist, she promptly received service within a few minutes! I have now been here, parched, stomach growling for 25 minutes. My attempts to call someone over continue to fail. I am sad, but darn it, pizza sounds delicious!  *Update 3* Its been 30 minutes. I'm going upstairs to Bout Time instead. I am still sad.  *Final update* I spoke with the manager, who didn't seem to care, but he offered a very sincere apology with a smile plastered over his face. Yaaaay
not impressed the salad dressing was so garlicy we couldent eat. it was supposed to be blue chrrse. the pizza was mediocre . expensive!!

This place stunk in so many ways. When you walk in the door the musty mildew smell hits you pretty hard. We had promised my kid pizza though so we went with it. We were sat immediately by a polite host but were sat in one of those long half booth half chairs tables where you can have a large party or separated tables. The place was half empty so I asked if we could have a table that was a little more private (there was a family inches from our table). The host said no that he had to seat us in the server's section and this long section was his whole section.  That was wierd. I mean easily 4 empty booths and as many empty tables in the place and the server can't find us? The pizza section of the menu was surprisingly small. We ordered a pepperoni kid's meal and a Carne Asada pizza. They were both hot, tastey, and priced right. The server (Matthew on the receipt or Nate on his name tag) stunk of BO so bad it made your eyes water. He didn't look dirty or anything, but oh god did he stink. Each time he came to the table his stench proceeded him and hung in the air after he left. When he reached for the check it was like he was winning a contest on how bad you can smell. The stink of the musty restaurant mixed with the stink of the server was too much to take. I would not recommend this place.

This was our first time ever at a California Pizza Kitchen restaurant.  The staff was friendly.  Our server was a little below average but her enthusiasm made up the difference.  The kitchen manager, Brady, came to our table and welcomed us.  To recognize us as first-time diners, he gave us a card for a free "small plate" to use in our next visit to this location. Thank you.  We received a complimentary Bianco  Flat bread.  I had the Thai chicken pizza and my wife has the BBQ chicken salad.  All were delicious.  We've now added this chain to our list for when we're out and about.

Not the best pizza out there but it's very good.  The full bar provides an excellent accompaniment to the meal and the staff is very good.  The only real downside is that it can take quite a bit of time to get a table when it's busy.

The entree we had are good, it made us full, I tried the hawaiian pizza, the crust is great but the flavor is something i wasnt expecting. It wasnt disappointing but it wasnt the one i like. The service is good but the wait time was bit long. Good place!

This is one of my favorites.  So many choices on the menu.  I have eaten at several locations and the quality of the food and service is consistently good.  There is lots of seating even for large groups. We had a group of 12 and our server was fast and friendly.  We were there on a Saturday late afternoon and the place was packed as it usually is. My favorite is the Pear & Gorgonzola pizza. They also serve beer and mixed drinks!!  My son used to work here so I have been to this location in Gateway and the Orem location many times. It will always be one of my favorites.

We went here for a quick lunch and my 1 star is based on not eating. Had we actually eaten,  it might be higher.  Upon entering the place it overwhelmingly smelled like cleaning supplies,  which was really strange as there was a huge brick pizza oven not more than 15 feet away. Why would it not smell like fresh baked pizza dough...or ANY food for that matter? Suspect!  We were asked to wait about 5 mins to sit although we were the only ones waiting at the time and there were at least 10 tables open. We were finally seated next to a large family with a screaming toddler and a young boy bugling out tunes through a rolled up kids menu.  Appetite now beginning to wane. After waiting over 10 mins with not one person coming to take our drink order or say they'd be right with us, we left.  Won't be back.

I love cpk I ordered the pina colada and they stopped making them so the manager offered another drink to me They gave us complimentary flatbread and a gift card I ordered the margarita pizza and noticed parsley on my pizza The manager noticed me taking it off and offered twice to remake it I was full and didn't want them to offer to remake one  They then offered free dessert but my friend and I didn't take it because again we were full but I was so impressed that they made an effort to right such a small wrong. Definitely my favorite location  AMAZING customer service I will be back

We went in for a quick sit down dinner on New Years Day. All of the people working seemed very nice and most of them acknowledged us and our one year old! The food was great and fast! We dinned around 5:30pm so it wasn't very crowded. We always get the original barbecue chicken pizza and it was great!

Service, food and prices were all just ok. It really irritates me that they charge you more for a thin crust pizza than for a regular. They say it's because there are more toppings, but looking around the table, I'm not convinced that is true. We did have a birthday at the table and they brought him a Shirley Temple which was nice.

The first time I went to cpk ... I had margarita pizza and it was yummy.. Since it was a bit pricey ... I could not go more often... After a long time, I went with my friends and the food was horrible ... The pizza was way overcooked ... The bread dry and extremely chewy... I like even the frozen dollar pizzas from gas store... So, my standards are not that high... But none of us could finish anything we ordered... It was such an unsatisfying experience... :( Oh yeah that "pizza" cost me around $18. Very disappointed!!
I really wanted to love it, the waitress was nice. The food made me sick though and she didn't clear our plates. Sorry CPK, it sucked this time.

You can't go wrong with this place. Food is always delicious. Service is good and I love the fact that you can sit outside and people watch and eat some yummy food.  Prices are good.  Seriously - salads, pasta, desserts, small plates - you can't go wrong.

We all have guilty pleasures, and CPK is one of mine! I'm not a huge fan of chain eateries, but when ever I sell my soul I tend to find myself here. Like Sky said I'm a fan of the open kitchen idea. It says I have nothing to hide, and coming from an intensive restaurant background IT REALLY SAYS A LOT! wink wink! I plead the fifth!  I have tried a plethora of items on the menu from pastas, hummus, pork tacos to pizzas. I have to say they have such a wide variety of items that it can be a bit overwhelming, let me ease your angst. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  The staff here is typically amazing even on a weekend night, they're knowledgeable, experienced, and know their stuff. If you have the chance give Bob a try he's one of the best servers you'll ever have. Take care of him, and tell him Brendan sent you! :)  In conclusion, when at Gateway and you need a culinary treat step into the CPK, ask for Bob, and enjoy!  P.S. Don't be afraid to try the kids mac 'n cheese! It's amazing and no modicum size either! Seriously, crazy good! You'll probably see me in the corner eating the Sicilian Pizza stealing bites of my sons Mac N Cheese!

The pizza was good, the drinks were great, and the pumpkin cheesecake was freaking fantastic!! Our server was a lot of fun and kept up with our drinks and order like a pro!! I will definitely  be back!

Just passing through SLC CPK sounded really good and was open late. The jamaican jerk chicken pizza was good but emilys white pizza was a little too ricotta laden. I'm not usually one to go to a restaurant within an hour of closing because the service goes downhill by the minute but this place was an exception. We got there 10 minutes before closing and were seated promptly with no rush. The service was good as emily and I were overly needy because it was our first good meal in a while. We weren't rushed and neither were the 2 parties of 10 and 8 that arrived after us-within 10 minutes of closing. Very good experience when emily and I could have been easily dissapointed.

We had a great server tonight at dinner. Her name was Jess and she was incredible. She was so on top of refills and great with the kids. The lettuce wraps are really great. The prices in general are pretty high but the food is really yummy. My daughter got the kids Mac and cheese and it was so great. Maybe one of the best Mac and cheeses I've ever had. I would really recommend this location.

I have never written a bad review before but I feel this restaurant needs improvement. A group of 5 of us let our server Lexi know at the very beginning we had a short period of time for lunch and it was acknowledged. We ordered quickly, I got a simple Margherita pizza and guacamole and chips for appetizer and dessert. I didn't get the guacamole and chips for 30 minutes in which I asked if they could box it up assuming my pizza would be out soon and I wouldn't have time to eat both at this point. I had already paid and gotten the bill at the very beginning because we were all in a rush and wanted to have that out of the way. I didn't get any of my food until we all stood up hinting at them we were needing to leave back to work. The restaurant was not very busy and there was no reason it should have taken this long. There was no apology and the pizza was cold. In addition no napkins or silverware were offered or given to me when I asked for a bag to put it all in. I am extremely disappointed in their service.
The Moroccan spiced chicken salad is phenomenal. I highly recommend it and also ask for Aiko as your server. She's awesome!

First off, I would have rated CPK 4 stars had it not been for lackluster service from our waiter.  Yeah, not the best service nor friendliest I would say.  A waiter should do a little more than just take your order and serve the food and by a little more I mean speak more than 5 words, two of which were "No problem."  Food is good, CPK BBQ Chicken salad was good (actually I prefer Rumbi's BBQ Chicken Salad over CPK's) and the overall the atmosphere was OK (super loud-so if you don't like that then you've been warned).

They say that an open kitchen is a sign of quality food. Just one of the aspects that I like about California Pizza Kitchen. This place is frequently visited by my friends and I because the food is perfect for sharing. For 3-4 people, just get an appetizer and maybe two pizzas and you are good for a nice meal that won't weigh you down. The atmosphere is clean cut with the right amount of decor to make your overall experience pleasing.  Out of all of the restaurants at The Gateway, this one is probably my favorite for any occasion from a date dinner before a movie to a day at the mall with friends. Recommendation(s): Habanero Carnitas Pizza, Strawberry Shortcake w/ Vanilla Ice Cream

This was my first time here, and I was not disappointed. The staff members were all very upbeat and ready to help. The restaurant's atmosphere was warm and relaxed. The lighting and seating were excellent and made for a comfortable dining experience. The food was great! We ordered the crispy Mac and cheese (which is very similar to TGIF's fried Mac and cheese) and the barbecue chicken pizza. Everything was cooked well and delicious, and we made sure to get a box for our leftovers! I'll be sure to visit California Pizza Kitchen again!

Food was good but the service was just okay. The waitress refilled drinks only once. Despite mine being empty most of the time. It also took half an hour for her to get our checks and bring them back though the restaurant was mostly empty at 2 pm.

I haven't tried their Pizza yet, this review is about the Artichoke Dip, Fish Tacos, and Seafood Pasta dishes my wife and I had a few days ago.  I have one question, WHERE ARE THE FLAVORS?  If I closed my eyes I wouldn't be able to tell what I was eating, ingredients with no flavor, and little or no seasoning or spices.  You eat,  you get full but not satisfied.

Ate here once--was very impressed with my food and drinks! Walked into the entryway to eat there again, and--I kid not--the entry and host areas reeked of a hot, fresh dump with a hint of post-wisdom-teeth-removal breath.  I don't think I ate anything that night...

09.20.10 numerous visits ambience: A- clean decor, seemingly clean kitchen, and clean environs all around. can't complain.  service: A- our server was polite, accommodating, and available.  food: A- i know. i was surprised too. thai crunch salad the thai part of the salad was lost. but what a great salad otherwise! crunchy and not overly salty or sweet - even though i tend to gravitate toward sweet. spinach artichoke thin crust pizza initially thought we'd get an incarnation of the spinach artichoke dip on thin pizza crust. i was wrong. the combination they use is perfect for thin crust pizza.  butter cake with vanilla ice cream dense but not overpowering. really does go well with ice cream and it's a cake that two people can eat easily.  overall: A- going into national chains like the cheesecake factory and cpk, my initial thought is to not want to like them. but for some reason i come out of them saying, "dang you for being delicious!" no different here.

Really great food - large portions. As we were leaving with our stroller a male staff member (Jonathan?) rushed over to open the door for us - this level of customer service is a nice change from many places that are less baby friendly
I always get the Jerk Chicken. They may have invented the BBQ chicken pizza , but this is my favorite! Enjoyed with a Chimay Grand Reserve Trappist beer, a great combination.

I ordered the tomato basil spaghettini with goat cheese for take out. There was hardly ANY basil--just  few slivers. There was tomato sauce and goat cheese, but not enough in my opinion. Are you really so hard-up for money that you can't afford to make the dish yummy? And worst of all, my dish tasted like the plastic it was packaged in. I couldn't finish it. I don't know what's happening to CPK. It used to be so good. Bummer.

Same mass produced pizza as always, but now your server is also a high pressure salesmen.   We were asked to download the app twice before we even ordered...  then they tried to sell us gift cards.  Terrible experience.

Passable. I don't really have anything BAD to say about CPK. It's just okay. I think everything is overpriced, but the service and atmosphere are good. This is not one of my fave pizza joints or one of my fave restaurants.

Even though they were super busy, we were seated and waited on quickly. The artichoke and spinach dip was fabulous. But the best pizza I've ever tasted is the Jamaican Jerk chicken Pizza. It's the perfect blend of sweet and spicy all on a thin crust which doesn't need to do anything but hold the toppings in place. I plan to come back again and again!
We had a fantastic meal last night, along with fabulous service! Dang, that butter cake is good!!!

Haven't been here in years. Came on a very busy Friday night before a show downtown. We were told it would be a 30 minute wait which ended up being closer to an hour. Normally I would be a little upset, but the manager was aware of the long waits and made an effort to talk to everyone that was waiting longer than expected. Once my friends and I were sat the manager joined the server at our table and apologized again for the long wait and offered an appetizer on CPK. The rest of the night went off without a hitch. Our server Nichole was very kind and attentive and the food was delicious. She knew we were in a hurry, but never made us feel rushed. I will be back!
Fast service and good food. The waiter could have been a little more courteous though. Overall good experience.

Greeted at the door immediately. Took a little too long to get service once seated even with only a few other tables in the place. Dishes were filthy. Marg. pizza was great.  After the wait service was fine. Staff was friendly. Will go elsewhere next time due to the cleanliness issues.

I love CPK. I can generally rely on it as a place to get full and be happy with my meal. Unlimited refills for Italian Soda's, with a Tostada (ordered thin crust style), Margherita, and Pepperoni something or other with an artichoke dip for an appetizer gets me in a good mood.

Excellent service at CPK. It has pizza in the name, but the real highlights are the salads, with interesting fusions of flavors. My favorite is the Thai Crunch salad, with Napa (yum!), peanuts...wonton skins and a carnival of other flavors. Miso Shrimp Salad is a close second.  Recommend if...  A) You want an amazing salad.  B) You love the hustle and bustle of a busy restaurant (at 10PM the place was still packed and I was there).  C) Want a casual, but trendy place to take your date before your movie (just right upstairs).

When it's 30 minutes to tip-off and you show up at a restaurant right next door to the venue (EnergySolutions, in this case), you better plan on being late to the game. That was our plan. California Pizza Kitchen beat our expectations, though, and we were pleasantly surprised at that. It was obvious when we walked in that the restaurant was full. People were loitering inside and out of the entrance, waiting for their table, and there was a line just to get on the list. When we got our turn, we were told it was at least a 25 minute wait, which, actually, probably isn't so much. But our indecisiveness showed on our faces, and the seater suggested that perhaps we would be interested in the counter, instead? We could seat there on a first come, first serve basis, and put our order in right away. We took her up on it, and in the next two minutes we went from a twenty-five minute wait to ordering and sipping on drinks. We also had the added fun of watching the kitchen (as well as the Yanks get beat by the Rangers on the overhead television). The waitress behind the counter was quick and friendly.  She took our orders right away, and kept our drinks topped off for the whole meal. The only reason I would rate this a four out of five instead of a five is because the pizza I ordered was only average.  I've had the Siciliano, which I love for its meat and spiciness, but tonight we tried the carne asada, which was not as good. In fact, it was slightly bland. The meat on it was ok, but the sauce was average and the green peppers lacked any flavor at all. With our pizza, we ordered an asian salad, which we shared, and it was fantastic.  Just enough chicken, just enough sauce, just enough crisps, and just enough fresh lettuce.  It was a great salad. If you go, then, and you're in a hurry, try the counter for something different, and something quick.

I went here with friends and was a bit worried because I'm Vegan. They had 1 salad I was able to get without asking to change anything, so it was better then I thought. My roasted vegetable salad was very good, of coarse I would have liked more choices but at least I had one option. I was not impressed with the service, I did not get my water topped off.

This California Pizza Kitchen is located in the Gateway Center in downtown Salt Lake City.  We've eaten at others, and have generally found the food to be very good. This one was no exception.  We were eager for a good meal, and some time to relax after a day-long drive from San Francisco.  The salad, the wine, the entrees were great.  The food was hot and tasty.  Service, also great.

You know, what can you say about a chain restaurant?  The service was attentive and friendly and that's 1/2 the battle.  I ordered the "Crunchy Thai Salad"...$9.95 for a BIG bowl of salad that was yummy - until I found a small piece of plastic in my mouth :O( I brought the plastic to the Managers attention and he laughed about it...a few minutes later he asked if I found anymore!  (I had stopped eating DOOFUS).  I think I'll write to corporate. Pretty much blew the deal, know what I mean? The Gen Manager of this location called me, less than 24hrs after my email!  Said what happened was "inexcusable" and immediately refunded my check...and then asked if anything else he could do for me...now THAT'S customer service!

A huge step up from your average pizza chain, but still a far cry from my favorite authentic pizza kitchens. Service here was super friendly, but I was disappointed when they were out of the beer I wanted to try. They serve a great selection of local brews, so I was bummed I wouldn't be able to sample what I wanted before heading home to Canada. Food was pretty good and the restaurant was clean and comfortably empty (that's what you get at 2pm on a Sunday in Utah!).

CPK...once a favorite go-to pizza place, but now it's just a mediocre pizza joint.  WHY?  Well, let's just say that the last few times I've gone, my pizza has looked like a personal pan pizza from Pizza Hut.  Teeny pizza, BIG plate.  This bothers me because I know what CPK is capable of.  I've gone on numerous occasions, but it just seems like they've taken a step down on the "We're going to give you the BEST" ladder.  Their food still tastes good, but for the price you're paying...I don't feel it's worth it.  But their food does taste GOOD...don't get me wrong.  For all of you that still want to try some of their food, here are TWO of my favorite pizzas: 1. California Club (a good option for salad lovers) 2. Chipotle Chicken (this one is SPICY...warning! ;)) ****Make sure you get these with their honey-wheat with whole grain crust...VERY tasty. Anyway, there you have it.  CPK offers great flavor (on their pizzas...haven't tried the rest), but I just don't feel you get as much bang for your buck anymore.  Hence the reason I gave it THREE stars.

My husband, 2 year old and I headed out to CPK with high hopes - these were quickly dashed. We were seated quickly however that was the last "quick" thing that happened. We sat for quite a while before our waiter came to take our drink order and then I noticed that he was preoccupied with a large table. We informed him we were ready to order as well which seemed to get him flustered. Another man brought out our order and I had to flag down our waiter to get refills. He brought my husband a 2nd soda however did not bring me a refill of water -- WATER!! I waited and waited - he was helping the big table, stood in front of our table talking to another waiter and still no refill. I had to ask him a 2nd time for a refill of water - I just cut my losses and told him we were ready for the check. Horrible service. The food was not very good and definitely not worth the cost. I might give another CPK a chance but I will definitely not return to this one.

Ok CPK, I'm not supposed to like you because you're a big chain restaurant. However, your Greek pizza (vegetarian style) is some of the best pizza I've ever had, and I'm not even vegetarian.  Just don't tell anyone, okay?

Had the tequila pasta. The sauce was unique and tasty but the dish didn't have very much chicken and was slightly rubbery. For the price I expect larger entrees or better quality. I don't have a problem with a restaurant being a chain but the atmosphere is the usual casual place- the open kitchen/pizza oven isn't enough justification for being overpriced either.

When it comes to making tasty pizzas, CPK somehow manages to do them well. They have an impressive selection of pizzas and pastas and they keep bringing out new items on their menu.  A few months back, they introduced the Mango Tandoori Chicken pizza (not sure if they have it anymore) and it was awesome! Just the right balance of sweet and spicy, it was delicious!  I also like their appetizers a lot, particularly their sesame ginger chicken dumplings and avocado egg rolls. Oh yes, they do serve cocktails, which is great (in Utah)! They have outdoor seating, which can be nice during summers. Sometimes you might have to wait a bit but its never over the top. But I do feel their pizzas are a tad bit pricey.

I was really impressed with this location.  We were in a hurry and wanted to order, eat and run within 20 minutes.  I feared we wouldn't make it when our waiter showed up with a "trainee" pin on his lapel.  Never fear though, because he made it happen.  Plus, we added a 3rd pizza and he quickly put in the order and we were on our way in no time.  Now, as for the pizza... ...I loved mine!!!  There were so many choices, it was a tough one.  I went with the Wild Mushroom.   It had cremini, shiitake, portobello and white mushrooms, Fontina and Mozzarella cheeses with a wild mushroom walnut pesto. Then, garnished with chopped Italian parsley.  YUM YUM YUM I'll be back and soon!!

Worst service ever!  Waited for 60 minutes after they said they called our name,  which they didn't we were right next to the check in counter!  Seated like 30 people before us!  Go some place else if you want to have good service!

Definitely good, we had tortilla rolls (awesome), bang bang shrimp (mmm), and the fried Mac n cheese--that was pretty bad so stay away. Luckily they were totally cool about replacing it! We got white corn tortilla chips and guac which was fine. Service was great.

Given that this is a chain, I'll keep it brief. This is our go-to for a quick bite before catching a movie on a weekend afternoon. You know what you're going to get, they'll rush it for you if you're in a time crunch (granted they're not slammed) and you leave satisfied. The service is always great- attentive without breathing down your neck and they handle tables with children really well.

I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants, but when you're starving and it's 20F outside, you will jump into the first place you see.  I was actually surprised by how much I liked it.  Granted, I have definitely had better pizzas, but this wasn't half bad.  My friend and I ordered one meat-loaded pizza which didn't skimp at all on the meat.  After I finished my half, I was completely satisfied.  Not sure I would have tried it given a different situation, nor that I would go again considering the higher rated pizza options in SLC, but it is definitely a viable option when in the area.

Artichoke dip is always on point! I ordered the works, and it didn't disappoint. The crust was a little thinner than I would've liked but all together it was good. My husband had the chile rejeno, it was a very small portion for the price that we paid and probably wouldn't order it again due to that but he ate all of it! So the taste wasn't the issue.

Pretty good choice for chain pizza.  I think it is tough to go wrong with anything barbecue chicken here.  This includes both the salad and the pizza.  I also really love the Waldorf chicken salad.  It is a pretty good take on an old classic.  Service is pretty good at this particular establishment.  No complaints overall, nothing out of the ordinary either good or bad.
Like always the food wa great! Ask for the server Joey! Exceptional service! He handled the 20 top like it was a couple. Thoroughly impressed.
Everything was good this visit.  The food took for-ev-er.  Other people got food before us - that can't happen.  No complaints other than that.
great service great food and even had an awesome gluten free menu will be coming back for sure :)
You know, it's a CPK. In fairness, I'd give it 3.5 stars, since our server was helpful. It's in a really bougie entertainment complex, if you're into that sort of thing.

Absolutely the WORST service! We had slightly less than an hour to eat before the movie so we chose to go to California Pizza Kitchen which was right next door.  Our son and his friends got better service from Dominos after the Warped Tour.  We were seated outside and waited a full ten minutes before we were even acknowledged by the waitress.  When she finally broke away from her conversation with another server, we ordered our drinks and food at the same time.  Before we ordered, we asked if there would be enough time to get our food and make it to the movie.  "Absolutely!"  After she brought our drinks, we didn't see her again until we were ready to leave.  Another server brought our food and got us silverware, no one checked to see how our food was.  A nice lady in a yellow dress brought us more water and got our check for us.  After we paid and were getting up to leave, our waitress finally came over to see how our dinner was.  (She brought us a duplicate check also.)  The food was good and we will try the restaurant again, but not that location.  Management seriously needs train their staff better. (Or maybe management needs more training too!)

We found the pizzas here tasty, but not extraordinarily good. We did find the place to be very noisy (and it was less than half full, judging by the tables in our section) and the prices very expensive for the amount of food that we got. An individual-sized cheese pizza for about $10 seemed pretty pricey to us.

What I like? The food! Santa Fe Chicken Pizza. DELICIOUS. (Yes, even with the onions.) The fact that its at the mall. The busy atmosphere.  I rarely have to wait long. They validate! What I don't like? Its a bit far from my home. (but so worth the drive!)

This pizzeria is great! It has both outdoors and indoors seating and the service is fast and curteous. And the food - delicious and interesting! This is the first time I've been to this restaurant chain. Right after touching down in SLC I was very tired so I decided to go with something safe for dinner - pizza. They had a great variety of regular pizza items plus a few items flagged "New!" on the menu, such as Tandoori Pizza which my wife ordered and The Works which I certainly had to get for myself. While all that was baking, we were served with some hot bread and butter. When it came, the food looked very good. The toppings covered the pizza well and were nicely placed instead of just tossed over. The prices were moderate and made this restaurant a reasonable eatery. Plus, the leftover tasted great the day after!

Talk about an under-appreciated restaurant! And I love it that way! Where else can a party of 6 get instantly seated on a Friday night?! The patronage levels at this location may have suffered (like everything else @ the Gateway "mall"), but the food quality has not. Seriously, the BBQ chicken pizza is a classic! Really, every pizza on the menu is good. I, personally, love CPK's thin, chewy pizza crusts. CPK is one of few restaurants that everyone in my little family will find something they like. Because who doesn't like pizza?! Also, the service has always been good, & fast. And yes, I am fully aware of the fact that I'm raving about a "chain" restaurant. But, like I said, I feel it is underappreciated, and 100% deserving entirely, of a 5-star review. At this location of CPK, they are doing everything right.

I usually like CPK, but this trip was not good, AT ALL! All the servers, and I mean ALL the servers were not happy to be at work. Not one of them smiled at anyone in the restaurant. I kind of expected more friendly faces a few days before Christmas.  Our food came to our table pretty fast, and it was correct. However, the next day I fell sick, not food poising sick, but closer to E. Coli sick! Really bad stomach craps, nauseous and dizzy, among other things. I've felt this way for 3-days, started late Saturday night and went right through Monday night - still feeling a little uneasy and it's Tuesday!

Two stars simply for attentive service. The ambience is what you expect of a restaurant downtown. Bustling movement, laughter, and overall family friendly. However, the food was very underwhelming especially when paired with the prices that California Pizza Kitchen offers. I started off (and finished) with the spinach artichoke dip that was hailed as one of their specialty dishes. What I expected was tufts of artichoke hearts and spinach baked in creamy goodness served piping hot with (maybe I set my expectations too high for a specialty) fresh tortilla chips. What I received however was a whole lot of.... lack in flavor. There was absolutely nothing special about it. Sure there was a good amount in there, but it didn't leave me wanting to dip in there more than three or four times. But let's be honest here, right? This is a pizza establishment. So let's level the playing field and judge from there. You can grab a medium pizza at say, a fast food chain, for about six dollars containing eight slices. But why wouldn't we want to spend a hefty fourteen to eighteen dollars for six pieces instead since it is the world renowned CPK? My family ordered the California Club and much to their dismay, out came a pizza no bigger than the trays the serve it on. The majority of the pizza was a salad. The sauce was nowhere to be found, the cheese barely apparent, and the bacon bits were scarce. What went wrong here? I have had peers tell me that they love it here, but it seems to be more hype than anything else. A bougie restaurant where pizzas are disguised as anything BUT pizzas. I don't even want to start on the pasta that my brother got because the price he paid for it and the amount served just seemed ridiculously unproportional. For a chain restaurant, I definitely had better standards. Thank you to our lovely waitress who made sure our cups were always filled to the brim and had the best attitude though. I'm just sorry the food wasn't as good the service. For now, I'll stick to the mom and pop pizza places if I wanna venture into something new. It'll take a lot for me to reconsider returning here.

Bad service (hostess forgot to add our names to the waitlist, server dropped one of our dishes resulting in one of our group waiting a loooong time for food without an offer to discount our bill, and overcharging for four of our other items), mediocre (at best) food, and a dingy restaurant make me wonder how this place, of all the places that have left The Gateway, is still in business. There are countless other options in the city that are worth visiting--this chain is definitely not on the list. I felt ripped off even though our meal (or most of it anyway) was covered by a gift card. Should I ever have the misfortune of getting another gift card to California Pizza Kitchen, I will give it away - perhaps to the folks at the shelter nearby.

Ordered delivery when stuck at work late, Yelp said 60-90 minutes for delivery, which was ok and the order was delivered in that time.... But.. The pizza was cold, like it just came out of the fridge cold... So was the bread and the cauliflower. We tried heating it up, but it was ruined, tasted like pizza from the $5 place at best...

I unfortunately have to give this a one star. I called in this morning and placed a reservation for 6:30pm on the dot for my entire family of 21 individuals. We all planned to eat before attending a Jazz game. This is why I placed the reservation. They said they would absolutely have our table ready but if we were a minute late they would give it away. All 21 of us showed up 10 minutes early (6:20pm) and discovered they had lost our reservation. "Don't worry", they said. We will get you back in a table in 10 minutes. We didn't get seated until 7:15pm. We literally waited for our seats, after placing a reservation, for 45 minutes. I understand they can't quite control the fact that all of their seats were physically occupied. They couldn't kick someone out of their spot. They had to wait until parties left to accommodate us. I get this. I get the reasons we had to wait. We tried to look at the menu and order our food while we were waiting. They initially said no to this, but eventually let us. The problem is that they never said sorry for losing my reservation and they never tried to make up for it. Like I said, I understand they couldn't magically create a table that seats 21 people after having lost the reservation. But they can make up for that by offering us all free drinks. Free desserts. An apology. Sure the food was ok. Our waitress was nice and great. But dang if I come to your restaurant and make a reservation for 21 people, it's for a reason. We have tickets to an event and can't sit and wait for 45 minutes for a table. We ended up missing the first quarter of the game because of the experience. Before writing this review, my wife tried to talk me out of it, because really, we feel bad for business that have seen failure at the Gateway. I really wish it could go back to how it was 10-15 years ago. I always try to visit the Gateway to help it survive. So I'm sorry if my review is doing the exact opposite of this, but perhaps CPK would be better off somewhere else. Let a restaurant come in that values people that walk through the door.

Our waiter was great, but the food was ridiculous. My boyfriend ordered fish tacos (they were around $14) and they came with burnt tortillas and hardly anything on the inside. He had to dig around to find the "fish", which was about two measly 1 inch pieces. We talked to our waiter who was very nice about it and took the tacos off our order, but we definitely won't be back any time soon!
One of the few remaining restaurants at Gateway. We have always had good experiences eating here. Good variety of meal options.

Way better than the CPKs in California.  Delicious spaghetti bolognese and the key lime pie was ridiculous!  I was just at the Anaheim location last week for lunch and thought it was just ok.  Pleasantly surprised.

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Took my wife here for her first time last night. They went above and beyond and helped us out. Good food and good service.

My visit here was amazing last night. During our girls night out, we each got our own pizzas that are not too big and definitely not too small!! I got the Five Cheese, fresh tomatoe pizza and.. It was to die for! It was perfectly juicy and amazingly cheesy as well. I couldn't stop eating and almost finished the whole thing! I HAD to take the rest for leftovers. Our service was absolutely fantastic as well. Our waitress was on  the ball and always had our water cups filled to the brim! She was funny and also very helpful when it came to asking her opinion on what to eat last night. I will come here again in the near future and I hope it's as great an experience as it was this time around!
Tiny one size only pizza. I ordered a bbq chicken pizza for 16 bucks it was tiny, thin crust, no cheese, barely any sauce, dry, way too much cilantro, and over cooked. I will not be going back.

Not great. Really expensive for a salad. I'm a vegetarian and asked for no chicken on the BBQ chicken salad. I was not offered extra anything in the place of chicken, nor would they discount the salad for me. I know you can't expect a discount for choosing to be vegetarian. But literally the salad was some iceberg lettuce, 10 black beans, WAY too many tomatoes (with a yucky weird old texture), and 5 tortilla strips sprinkled on top. And it was upwards of $15. I left hungry and unimpressed. It was bland and boring and the service was meh as well. We were one of 5 tables and it took us 15 minutes to get our check after we were done. Won't be back. No reason to go anymore. Veggie options suck and it's overpriced for the flavor and what you get. The dining experience was a total let down in general.

location: North Salt Lake, Salt Lake City, UT
review: This place the Bomb Diggity! Awesome food and awesome service. I will definitely keep coming back!

Had one of the best waiters I've ever had at this restaurant today - Tony was charming, calm, patient, responsive, etc. to our party of seven (two adults, five kids). The food was yummy, and more than anything, I felt taken care of. Love a restaurant where I feel like the staff actually care about us and our satisfaction. Highly recommend!
The pizza was pretty good, especially the crust. However the atmosphere and bathrooms need some TLC. The avacado appetizer was also overpriced.

I won't return, simply because it is overpriced mediocre food. We went in a larger group, so I was able to try a bit of everything.  I don't mind pricey food, and wasn't shocked (like others in our party) that the pizza size was about the size of a large dinner plate.  Good thing we asked before we ordered, because sharing a pizza might be fine for some, but not for the hungry. I love the way the pizzas were prepared, but in the end, they were tough, rubbery, and honestly not amazing.  If you like tough pizza, you might like CPK.  My wife got a shrimp pasta of some kind, and it was pretty good.  Given the name of the restaurant, it's bad when the pizzas are the worst thing on the menu. We did not get the thin crust pizzas, yet the pizza was still really thin.  I don't mind thin pizza, I just hate to think of how much you would feel ripped off if you did order the thin crust.  Do yourself a favor, and avoid this place if you want some pizza.  All of the chain places (even the bad ones) have better pizza, and much better value.  Don't get me wrong, the pizza isn't awful, because how could pizza taste bad?  It's just among some of the lamest pizza I've had.  Fresh, lame pizza. Enough about the food.  If you're into cramped seating, this is the place for you.  You may not notice with the lower lighting, but with the sunlight, it won't matter.  Use the bathroom at another establishment too: there is freezing cold water (no hot water?) and drying your hands isn't easy either.

The food was delicious. The waiter was a little aloof but nice.  The kitchen lost our ticket so we waited a long time for the food.  The manager offered us a free dessert.  We didn't get the exact order on the Kung pow pasta and they had to remove it from the ticket.  Overall it wasn't impressive but it wasn't bad, in the end.
Not impressed. Very run down and grubby in appearance. Grease smears on wall behind our heads.
Good food, but don't feel like the prices are worth it for a chain restaurant.
